ygData.subject: RE: PoA bard quests plus a rant
ygData.msgSnippet: When the plane of sky opened, they had to put them somewhere, so they gave them a zone for meetings, training and such. From: Ryan Honeyman
ygData.messageBody:
When the plane of sky opened, they had to put them somewhere, so they gave
them a zone for meetings, training and such.

From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>

> about. At later levels having grown up in Sol B and Lower Guk from 35-45
> you get into sort of a mindset of pull-kill, pull-kill, pull-kill. Higher
> level players sometimes don't use their imaginations about things to do!
> Here are some suggestions of interesting things for high levels to do for
> experience:

There are plenty of named NPCs to drop as well, like the Priests of
Discord, the leader of the Greenbloods(?) in Oggok whose name evades
me... something like Sonooog. Hell I love Oggok, I've cleared most
of the bouncers that people have never even heard of before. I've
gone all the way to the bank to pull ogres heheehe. (most are green
but the loot is good for buying soulstones ;)

Then again, I'm enjoying the company of my friends much more now.
The game has lost it's sparkle, but the friendships I've made keep
me coming back every night.

> [44 Bard] Crier (Half Elf) <Seekers of Norrath> ZONE: workplane

[50 Bard] Harmonic (Half-Elf) <The Unbidden> ZONE: cshome

has anyone noticed this new zone the guides hang out in?

Harm.
